title: Association Challenge
description: Find the connection between seemingly unrelated items!

questions.question: What do 'diamond,' 'heart,' 'club,' and 'spade' have in common?
options: They are suits in a deck of cards
questions.explanation: Diamond, heart, club, and spade are the four suits in a standard deck of playing cards. Each suit has 13 cards, making 52 cards total.

questions.question: What connects 'Mercury,' 'Venus,' 'Mars,' and 'Jupiter'?
options: They are all planets AND Roman gods
questions.explanation: Mercury, Venus, Mars, and Jupiter are all planets in our solar system AND names of ancient Roman gods. The planets were named by ancient Romans who observed them in the night sky.

questions.question: What do 'bass,' 'bow,' and 'lead' have in common?
options: They are all words with two different pronunciations and meanings
questions.explanation: Bass, bow, and lead are all heteronyms — words spelled the same but with different pronunciations and meanings (e.g., bass fish vs. bass guitar, bow and arrow vs. take a bow).

questions.question: What connects 'Washington,' 'Jefferson,' 'Roosevelt,' and 'Lincoln'?
questions.explanation: Washington, Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Lincoln are the four presidents carved into Mount Rushmore in South Dakota, completed in 1941.

questions.question: What do 'robin,' 'cardinal,' 'eagle,' and 'blue jay' have in common beyond being birds?
options: They are all named after colors
They are all names of sports teams
questions.explanation: Robin, Cardinal, Eagle, and Blue Jay are all names of professional sports teams — the Orioles (close to robin), Cardinals, Eagles, and Blue Jays, among others.

questions.question: What connects 'spring,' 'fall,' 'bank,' and 'match'?
options: They all have multiple unrelated meanings
questions.explanation: Spring (season/water source/coil), fall (season/to tumble), bank (financial/river edge), and match (game/fire starter) all have multiple completely different meanings.

questions.question: What do 'Nile,' 'Amazon,' 'Mississippi,' and 'Danube' have in common?
options: They are the four longest rivers in the world
questions.explanation: The Nile, Amazon, Mississippi, and Danube are all major rivers on different continents: Africa, South America, North America, and Europe respectively.

questions.question: What connects 'baker's dozen,' 'unlucky,' 'Friday the ___,' and 'Apollo ___'?
questions.explanation: They are all associated with the number 13: a baker's dozen is 13, 13 is considered unlucky, 'Friday the 13th' is a superstitious date, and Apollo 13 was the famous troubled NASA mission.

questions.question: What do 'Granny Smith,' 'Fuji,' 'Honeycrisp,' and 'Gala' have in common?
questions.explanation: Granny Smith, Fuji, Honeycrisp, and Gala are all popular varieties of apples. Granny Smith is tart and green, while Fuji and Gala are sweet and red.

questions.question: What connects 'ivory,' 'ebony,' 'grand,' and 'upright'?
options: They all describe types or parts of pianos
questions.explanation: They all relate to pianos: ivory and ebony describe the traditional materials for white and black piano keys, while grand and upright are types of pianos.

questions.question: What do 'Lima,' 'Kidney,' 'Navy,' and 'Pinto' have in common?
options: They are all types of beans
questions.explanation: Lima, kidney, navy, and pinto are all types of beans. Each has a distinct appearance and is used in different cuisines around the world.

questions.question: What connects 'carat,' 'table,' 'crown,' and 'pavilion'?
options: They are parts or measurements of a cut gemstone
questions.explanation: Carat (weight), table (flat top surface), crown (upper portion), and pavilion (lower portion) are all terms used to describe parts or measurements of a cut gemstone, particularly a diamond.

questions.question: What do 'Old Faithful,' 'Yellowstone,' 'Grand Prismatic,' and 'Mammoth Hot Springs' have in common?
options: They are all features in Yellowstone National Park
questions.explanation: Old Faithful (geyser), Grand Prismatic Spring (hot spring), and Mammoth Hot Springs are all famous features within Yellowstone National Park, America's first national park.

questions.question: What connects 'treble,' 'bass,' 'alto,' and 'tenor'?
options: They are all vocal ranges or musical terms
questions.explanation: Treble, bass, alto, and tenor are all terms used in music. Treble and bass are clefs, while alto, tenor, treble (soprano), and bass are vocal ranges.

questions.question: What do 'Windsor,' 'half-Windsor,' 'four-in-hand,' and 'Pratt' have in common?
options: They are types of knots for neckties
questions.explanation: Windsor, half-Windsor, four-in-hand, and Pratt are all types of necktie knots. The four-in-hand is the most common, while the Windsor is the most formal.
